gurmukhi: iqn kY sMig n aun kI bnI ] qb kiRpwl icq mo ieh gnI ]
transliteration: Tin Kai San(i) Na Oun Koo Badoo|| Tah Kridaal Chit Mo Eh Gadoo||
translation: But he could not reconcile with them; then Kirpal thought within his mind:

gurmukhi: AYis Gwiq iPr hwQ n AYhY ] sbhUM Pyr smo Cil jYhY ]14]
transliteration: Ais(i) Ghaat(i) Phir Haath Na Aihai|| Sab-hoon Pher Samo Chhal(i) Jaihai||14||
translation: That such an opportunity will not be available again, because the circle of time deceives everybody.14.

gurmukhi: gopwlY su AbY gih lIjY ] kYd kIjIAY kY bD kIjY ]
transliteration: Gopaalai Su Abai Gad(i) Loojai|| Kaid Koojooai Kai Badh Koojai||
translation: He decided to catch hold of Gopal immediately, either to imprision him or kill him.

gurmukhi: qnk Bnk jb iqn sun pweI ] inj dl jwq BXo BtrweI ]15]
transliteration: Tanak Bhanak Jab Tin Soun Paaoo|| Nij Dal Jaat Bhayo Bhatraaoo||15||
translation: When Gopal got scent of the conspiracy, he escaped to his people (forces).15.
When Gopal was gone, Kirpal was filled with anger.
Himmat and Hussain rushed for fighting in the field.16.
With great pride, more warriors followed.
On the other side, the trumpets also resounded and the horses danced in the battlefield.
The warriors enthusiastically strike their weapons, creating clattering sound.18.
The fearless warriors blow their horns and shout loudly.
The swords are struck and the warriors are lying on the ground.19.
The guns, arrows, lances and axes create noises.
